meanings.definition: To be entitled to a particular benefit or privilege
meanings.sent1: She can qualify for the scholarship with her high grades.
meanings.sent2: To enter the contest, you must qualify by submitting your application on time.
meanings.sent3: He tried to qualify for the discount by pretending to be a senior citizen.
meanings.sent4: Her exceptional skills qualify her as a top candidate for the job.
meanings.sent5: Only those who qualify will receive a special invitation to the event.

meanings.definition: To meet the necessary requirements or conditions
meanings.sent1: If you study hard, you will qualify for the advanced class.
meanings.sent2: To qualify for the race, you need to complete the registration form.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to qualify the ingredients before starting the recipe.
meanings.sent4: Her experience and expertise qualify her as a suitable candidate for the position.
meanings.sent5: Make sure you qualify for the discount before making your purchase.

meanings.definition: To modify or limit the meaning of a statement or claim
meanings.sent1: Using 'sometimes' can qualify the absolute nature of the statement.
meanings.sent2: To avoid confusion, it is important to qualify your argument with specific examples.
meanings.sent3: The comedian tried to qualify his joke with a funny gesture.
meanings.sent4: Her tone of voice helped to qualify the seriousness of her statement.
meanings.sent5: Adding a disclaimer can help qualify the information provided in the report.
